name: Bryce Canyon Visitor Center
description: The Bryce Canyon Visitor Center might be one of your first stops when visiting Bryce Canyon National Park. Here you can obtain driving and hiking directions beyond those available on this website, weather forecasts, a current schedule of Park Ranger guided programs, Junior Ranger booklets, and information on area services including lodging, dining and other attractions. Entrance passes cannot be purchased at the visitor center.

images.title: Bryce Canyon Visitor Center
images.altText: Sign reading Bryce Canyon National Park with an arrowhead stands before large brown building
images.caption: The park Visitor Center is located 1 mile past the park entrance and is open most days at 8 a.m.

images.title: Visitor Center Bookstore
images.altText: Stands of merchandise and two shoppers in a gift shop
images.caption: All purchases made at the Visitor Center bookstore directly support the park through the Bryce Canyon Association

images.title: Junior Rangers in Park Museum
images.altText: A woman helps three children lying on ground with workbook in park museum
images.caption: The park museum provides an opportunity to learn about the park and a place to work on Junior Ranger books.

images.title: Park Orientation
images.altText: A relief map and wall map of Bryce Canyon with a TV screen and entrance to exhibit area
images.caption: The Visitor Center provides exhibits, orientation materials, a park film and more.

images.title: The Bryce Canyon Shuttle provides service from the Visitor Center
images.altText: A white and green shuttle bus with an arrowhead logo makes a turn
images.caption: From April to October, the Bryce Canyon Shuttle provides free service from the Visitor Center to popular park overlooks and facilities.

images.title: Visitor Center Solar Photovoltaic Arrays
images.altText: Two large solar panels stand tilted at an angle to the sky in a forest
images.caption: The park's Concentrating Solar Photovoltaic (CPV) array generates around 400,000 kilowatt hours a year. The two 70' x 50' tracking generators are located along the Shared Use Path near the Visitor Center.

operatingHours.description:
Winter hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
Spring and Fall hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 
Summer (standard) hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

The Bookstore is closed on Thanksgiving, but the rest of the Visitor Center is open. The Visitor Center is closed on Christmas Day.
operatingHours.name: Bryce Canyon Visitor Center

addresses.line2: Bryce Canyon National Park Visitor Center
